display.label: Zoom
display.description: Easily manage users, meetings, and webinars in your Zoom account

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization URL for Zoom
inputs.label: Authorize URL

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Token URL for Zoom
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: Scopes are configured when a Zoom OAuth 2.0 app is created
inputs.label: Scopes

inputs.comments: Client Identifier of your app for Zoom
inputs.label: Client ID

inputs.comments: Client Secret of your app for Zoom
inputs.label: Client Secret

documentation.description:
This component uses OAuth 2.0 to connect to Zoom's API.
To create a Zoom OAuth 2.0 app, first visit the [Zoom Marketplace](https://marketplace.zoom.us/).
Log in and click **Develop** -> **Build an App**.
Select **OAuth** as your **app type** and give your app a name.
Select that you want an **Account-level app**.
_Do not_ elect to publish your app to Marketplace.

On the next page give your app an icon (probably your core product's logo).
Add Prismatic's OAuth callback URL, `https://oauth2.prismatic.io/callback` to two places: the **Redirect URL for OAuth** and to **Add allow lists**.

Take note of the **Client ID** and **Client secret** that were generated - these will be entered into Prismatic when you create an integration that uses the Zoom component.
Click **Continue**.

Give your app a short description, and fill in the remaining basic information about your app.
This is the information your customers will see when they grant your integration permission to interact with Zoom on their behalf.
Click **Continue**.

You can safely ignore the **Verification Token** that is generated for you on the next screen - that's used for incoming webhooks from Zoom.
Click **Continue**.

#### Zoom OAuth 2.0 Scopes

**Scopes** determine what an integration is allowed to do on your customer's behalf.
For Zoom apps, scopes are configured on the next page.
For the correct permissions, add the following scopes to your app:

- If you plan to view and manage **meetings**, add `meeting:master`, `meeting:read:admin` and `meeting:write:admin`
- If you plan to view and manage **webinars**, add `webinar:master`, `webinar:read:admin` and `webinar:write:admin`
- If you plan to view and manage **recordings**, add `recording:master`, `recording:read:admin` and `recording:write:admin`
- If you plan to view and manage **users**, add `user:master`, `user:read:admin` and `user:write:admin`

You can omit the other scopes, as this component does not implement actions for accounts, billing, etc.
Click **Continue** to complete the creation of your OAuth app.

You can now authenticate your integration with Zoom.
Additional information on Zoom OAuth 2.0 apps is available in [Zoom's documentation](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth/).

display.label: Create Meeting
display.description: Create a new meeting with an existing user as the host

inputs.comments: Provide the unique identifier of a user.
inputs.label: User Id

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the topic.
inputs.label: Topic

inputs.comments: Provide a value from the provided list.
inputs.label: Meeting Type

inputs.comments: Provide a value for the start time of the meeting. Provide your value in the following format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ
inputs.label: Start Time

inputs.comments: Provide a value for the duration in minutes. This field is only used for scheduled meetings.
inputs.label: Duration

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for a valid timezone. Refer to the Id value in the timezone list: https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/other-references/abbreviation-lists#timezones
inputs.label: Timezone

inputs.comments: Provide a value up to 10 characters for the password.
inputs.label: Password

inputs.comments: Provide a string value for the agenda. This property has a maximum length of 2,000 characters.
inputs.example: In this meeting we will discuss...
inputs.label: Agenda

inputs.comments: Pick a value from the provided list.
inputs.label: Recurrence

inputs.comments: This value relates to the cadence at which your meetings will occur. This value directly related to recurrence. For more information on this value and how it affects your meetings, refer to the Zoom documentation: https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/meetings/meetingcreate
inputs.label: Repeat Interval

inputs.comments: Provide a value from 1-7 to determine which days of the week your meeting will occur on. You can also provide a string of comma separated integers. For instance if you want your meeting to occur every Tuesday and Sunday, provide '1, 3'. This field is required if you selected type 2 for recurrence.
inputs.label: Weekly Day

inputs.comments: Provide a value from 1-31 to determine which days of the month your meeting will occur on. For instance if you want your meeting to occur every 5th of each month, provide a 5. This field is required if you selected type 3 for recurrence.
inputs.label: Monthly Day

inputs.comments: Provide a value for the week of the month you would like your meeting to occur on. This field is required if you selected type 3 for recurrence.
inputs.label: Monthly Week

inputs.comments: Provide a value from 1-7 to determine which days of the day of the week your monthly meeting will occur on. You must also provide a value for monthly week.  For instance if you want your meeting to occur every Tuesday and Sunday, provide '1, 3'. This field is required if you selected type 2 for recurrence.
inputs.label: Monthly Week Day

inputs.comments: Provide a valid date time value for when the last meeting will occur.
inputs.label: End Date Time

inputs.comments: This flag will determine if the host's video is turned on by default.
inputs.label: Host Video On Start

inputs.comments: This flag will determine if participants video is turned on by default.
inputs.label: Participant Video

inputs.comments: This flag will determine if participants are allowed to join before the host.
inputs.label: Join Before Host

inputs.comments: If joinBeforeHost is true, supply one of the given values.
inputs.label: Time To Join Before Host

inputs.comments: This flag will determine if participants are muted by default when they join.
inputs.label: Mute Upon Entry

inputs.comments: This flag will determine if a watermark will be displayed on screen share.
inputs.label: Use Watermark

inputs.comments: This flag will determine whether or not to use a personal meeting Id, over a generated meeting Id.
inputs.label: Use Personal Meeting ID

inputs.comments: This flag will determine the approval type of the meeting.
inputs.label: Approval Type

inputs.comments: Provide a value from the provided list.
inputs.label: Registration Type

inputs.comments: This flag will determine whether or not to send an email notification upon registration.
inputs.label: Registration Email Notifications

inputs.comments: This flag will determine if participants audio used telephony or VoIP
inputs.label: Audio Method

inputs.comments: This value will determine your automatic recording settings.
inputs.label: Auto Recording

inputs.comments: For each item specify the code of a country that is available for global dial in.
inputs.label: Global Dial In Countries

display.label: Raw Request
display.description: Issue a raw HTTP request with the configured connection

inputs.comments: This is the URL to call.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.placeholder: The file name to apply to a file
inputs.comments: File names to apply to the file data inputs. Keys must match the file data keys above.
inputs.label: File Data File Names

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

documentation.description:
[Zoom](https://zoom.us/) is a video teleconferencing software program developed by Zoom Video Communications.
The Zoom component allows you to manage meetings, recordings, users and webinars.
